content:
Here is the cleaned up text:

Preparing for Shift Scheduling

Before your planners can create shifts and assign them, configure Salesforce for shift scheduling.

Workforce Engagement is available in Enterprise, Performance, and Unlimited Editions. Shift Scheduling is available in the Contact Center Stock Keeping Unit (SKU), Einstein 1 Service Edition, and Service Suites.

The steps differ depending on whether you’re using an Omni-Channel queue-based routing workflow or a non-Omni workflow.

CONFIGURATION STEP	DOCUMENTATION
Step 1: Assign permission sets to users.
Assign the Shift Scheduling Planner or Workforce Engagement Planner permission set to users who create and schedule shifts. Assign the Shift Scheduling Agent or Workforce Engagement Agent permission set to your agents.	
Manage Permission Set Assignments

Workforce Engagement User Permission Sets

Step 2: Set standard object permissions for Service Resource Preferences to View All.

Edit Object Permissions in Profiles

Step 3: Add related lists to objects.

Add the Time Slots related list to the Operating Hours object.
Add the Skill Requirements related list to the Job Profiles object.
Add the Service Territory, Shifts, Skills, Preferences, Absences, and Time Sheets related lists to the page layout for the Service Resources object.
Add the Skill Requirements related list to the Job Profile object if you’re using Shift Scheduling or a workflow other than Omni-Channel queue-based routing in Workforce Engagement.	
Add a Related List to an Object

Step 4: Create operating hours with time slots.

Create Operating Hours with Time Slots

Step 5: Create service territories for contact centers where your agents work.

Create a Service Territory

Step 6: Create a service resource for each agent that you want to assign shifts to.

Create Service Resources for Agents

Step 7: If you’re using Shift Scheduling or a workflow other than Omni-Channel queue-based routing in Workforce Engagement, create skills so that scheduling can match agents’ abilities with work assignments.

Create and Assign Skills

Step 8: Create job profiles to associate with your shifts.

Create a Job Profile

Step 9: (Omni-Channel queue-based routing workflow in Workforce Engagement) Enable Omni-Channel, set up queues, and associate routing configurations with each queue. Add agent users as queue members and map job profiles to queues.

Enable Omni-Channel

Create Omni-Channel Queues

Enable Workforce Engagement and Feature Preferences

Map Job Profiles to Queues

Step 10: Create scheduling rules that help to match agents to shifts.

Create a Match Territory rule.
If you’re using Shift Scheduling or a workflow other than Omni-Channel queue-based routing in Workforce Engagement, create a Match Skills rule.
If you’re using a queue-based workflow in Workforce Engagement, create a Match Queue rule.
Optionally, add more rules to narrow down the pool of candidates for each shift.

Create a Scheduling Rule

Step 11: Create scheduling constraints, such as work limits, to associate with scheduling rules.

Create a Scheduling Constraint

Step 12: Create scheduling objectives to reflect business goals.

Create a Scheduling Objective

Step 13: Let agents see assigned shifts.

Allow Agents to See Their Assigned Shifts with an Apex Trigger
title: Preparing for Shift Scheduling in Service Cloud
